text:
e="preserve">Margit Buchhalter Feldman (June 12, 1929 – April 14, 2020) was a Hungarian-American public speaker, educator, activist, and Holocaust survivor. Feldman and her family put in a concentration camp in 1944, where her parents were killed. She survived after lying about her age, in which the Nazis put her in a work camp. She was freed from Bergen-Belsen concentration camp on April 15, 1945. She was born in Budapest.
Feldman died on April 14, 2020 in Somerset, New Jersey of COVID-19, aged 90.
